posts.author: SolidusMath
posts.content:
*EDIT* It's Arelith and I think you guys know the restriction but if not let me know...

I just got an awesomebuild worked up for me by Empyre65 and would love to get another if the time is there....

I want to play a ultimate bag guy type cleric and whatever else you guys see fit.

1] Martial weapons as I like pulling the greatsword and longbow at times but practically tower shield and sword are the jam.
2] The whole SF, GSF, ESF with evocation. Also Greater Ruin and Hellball.
3] UMD would be a glory to behold as would tumble but..ya know sacrifice for the greater good if needed.
4] Spell focuses in enchantment are super desirous as the end result is 35% off enchanting items with ESF. hese would be more useful if had at at early levels but again sacrifice and all.
5] Lore to be maxed for RP, could cross class UMD to get 9th lvl scrolls right? On that note so could tumble for +3 AC i guess.
6] Will take +2 to two different ability scores as the ELC don't bother me. I was thinking STR and WIS?
7] Would like no ability below 10 as it's a weird thing I've got going on
8] Human
9] Maybe FTR lvl's for EWS? this sounds great but what do I know?

I am new to playing clerics but go on and throw it at me because it will be fun to learn IG how to memorize and cast to the max!
Thanks again for the work it takes and Ill answer any questions you want. From a total noob to those who know a thing or two about NWN.
---*crosses fingers and pushes submit---*

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I don't think you can have all of that in one build. I know for sure that you cannot cross-train UMD. I could build for you a self-buffing melee Cleric, but offensive casting Clerics are outside my experience.
Here is a recent discussion of a build for Arelith similar to what you requested.

posts.author: Hafen
posts.content:
You will suffer from insuficient skill points.

What you ask for is very strong magic leaving your combat weak. As human you have edge of one additional feat over my drow though. You can go this route if you take something similar i was planning before: 4 fighter, 3 bard/rogue and rest cleric.

Fighter to gain free combat oriented feats, and perhaps take 4 of it pre epic to receive 4th attack. Rogue/bard to get +6 AC from tumble and 15 umd (15 umd is enough to use most items and scrolls).

If you wish to go both ways you have to accept lower DC on spells ending with wis about 30 with gears, because you will need high str for AB and con for hps - not just for pvp but also pvm to free your spells slots for offensive ones (instead having them filled with divine power and other combat buffs).

Also with adding other classes is impossible to get great ruin and hell ball. Both require 21 cleric, hell ball 32 spellcraft (from 27th level onwards).

Good build, Empyre, for real. You're becoming a very good builder. I would, however, like to suggest a few changes to it.

Go Cleric 16 Monk 4 Pre-epic, then on lvls 26-27-28 take Rogue and gain UMD, Sneak Attack (2d6), Uncanny Dodge, which is vital to a dex-based toon and 1 BAB (would be 15 pre-epic instead of 14) at the cost of 1 AC (20 Wisdom) and a few spells per day, plus indispellability. It's unavoidable, really, with the lvl 30 cap and the 3 minimum levels per class restriction. Just Uncanny Dodge will make it so that you don't lose 13 AC points from DEX (counting DEX as capped here) in certain situations. That alone would justify the investment, plus the BAB and UMD and you have a winner

Take it EZ!

The feat selection is perfect, so is the order in which you take them. Nothing to add there

That sounds good. Another alternative would be to take 4 levels of Monk pre-epic, and a 5th at level 27.
